heading: # Dialogs
headingText: The `v-dialog` component inform users about a specific task and may contain critical information, require decisions, or involve multiple tasks. Use dialogs sparingly because they are interruptive.

usage.desc: A dialog contains two slots, one for its activator and one for its content (default). Good for Privacy Policies.

without-activator.heading: ### Without activator
without-activator.desc: If for some reason you are unable to use the activator slot, be sure to add the `.stop` modifier to the event that triggers the dialog.

modal.heading: ### Modal
modal.desc: Similar to a Simple Dialog, except that it's not dismissed when touching outside.

fullscreen.heading: ### Fullscreen
fullscreen.desc: Due to limited space, full-screen dialogs may be more appropriate for mobile devices than dialogs used on devices with larger screens.

form.heading: ### Form
form.desc: Just a simple example of a form in a dialog.

scrollable.heading: ### Scrollable
scrollable.desc: Example of a dialog with scrollable content.

overflowed.heading: ### Overflowed
overflowed.desc: Modals that do not fit within the available window space will scroll the container.

advanced.heading: ### Nested dialogs
advanced.desc: Dialogs can be nested: you can open one dialog from another.

loader.heading: ### Loader
loader.desc: The `v-dialog` component makes it easy to create a customized loading experience for your application.

props.fullWidth: Forces the dialog to expand 100% of available width.
props.internalActivator: Detaches the menu content inside of the component as opposed to the document.
props.noClickAnimation: Disables the bounce effect when clicking outside of a `v-dialog`'s content when using the **persistent** prop.
props.openOnHover: Designates whether component should activate when its activator is hovered.
props.persistent: Clicking outside of the element will not deactivate it.
props.retainFocus: Tab focus will return to the first child of the dialog by default. Disable this when using external tools that require focus such as TinyMCE or vue-clipboard.
props.scrollable: When set to true, expects a `v-card` and a `v-card-text` component with a designated height. For more information, check out the [scrollable example](/components/dialogs#scrollable).

events.click:outside: Event that fires when clicking outside an active dialog.
events.keydown: Event that fires when key is pressed. If dialog is active and not using the **persistent** prop, the **esc** key will deactivate it.
